text: Fay McKenzie (February 19, 1918 - April 16, 2019) was an American actress. She was best known for her leading lady roles. She appeared in two movies with Gene Autry in 1941 and 1942. McKenzie was the daughter of the actor Robert McKenzie and actress Eva McKenzie. One of her first roles was at the age of six in The Dramatic Life of Abraham Lincoln (1924) where she played Sarah Lincoln. She married screenwriter Tom Waldman. McKenzie was born on February 19, 1918, in Hollywood, California. She died on April 16, 2019 in Los Angeles, at the age of 101. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1918 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American centenarians Category:American silent movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:Actors from Hollywood
title: Fay McKenzie
